entries.title: Windows 7 might not be completely dead after all
entries.description: Windows 7 gets UEFI and Secure Boot after many businesses refuse to move away from the OS.

entries.title: The best Dolby Atmos soundbars of CES 2023
entries.description: TVs may have been the main AV highlight at CES, but new soundbars also made a splash at the show.

entries.title: Chrome 109 improves video calls but it's up to developers to add the changes
entries.description: Besides video conferencing apps, Chrome 109 now supports the experimental SPC standard for faster payments.

entries.title: Hundreds of fake AnyDesk sites push Vidar info-stealing malware
entries.description: A major campaign was recently discovered, with more than 1,300 fake sites promoting malware.

entries.title: PC sales fell sharply in 2022, and not even Apple is safe
entries.description: Desktop and laptop sales plummeted in 2022 following a two-year high: Apple even struggled to sell its Macs.

entries.title: Sony Patent would have you yell at your TV to skip commercials
entries.description: A popular Sony TV patent meme is only half the story of a pretty bizarre idea

entries.title: Twitter hacked: here's how to protect your account
entries.description: As over 200 million Twitter users' logins have reportedly been compromised, experts share some tips to secure your profile.

entries.title: How VPN services affect internet speed
entries.description: While the encryption process might slow down your connection, a VPN can also improve your online experiences.

entries.title: The iPhone 16 Pro could feature the next massive leap in iPhone design
entries.description: The iPhone 16 Pro and Pro Max will reportedly have under-display Face ID, allowing for a much smaller camera cut-out.

entries.title: Fake ChatGPT apps are everywhere on Android and iOS app stores
entries.description: Spike in ChatGPT interest has seen the emergence of many fake apps charging for non-existent ‘premium’ versions.

entries.title: A new Xbox Series X update just dropped and could save your energy bills
entries.description: An update that’s just arrived for all Xbox Insider members brings a new shutdown mode to Xbox Series X.

entries.title: Sony's affordable new Walkman could make your digital music sound better than ever
entries.description: Sony's new Android-powered Walkman, the NW-A306, has several features that help it enhance your compressed music files.

entries.title: Google Docs is fixing this annoying print preview issue
entries.description: Google’s free what-you-see-is-what-you-get document editor will show you non-printed character formatting, but you might have to wait for the privilege.

entries.title: Nvidia and Valve want to bolster Steam Deck with better GeForce Now support
entries.description: Do you use Nvidia’s GeForce Now streaming service on the Steam Deck? Then here’s some good news.

entries.title: Apple’s OLED MacBook could arrive as soon as next year
entries.description: Apple analysis have speculated that the first OLED MacBook could arrive in 2024.

entries.title: Dangerous new cybercrime gang attacks government and military targets
entries.description: Hackers found using unorthodox tactics to deploy infostealers, with at least seven organizations hit.

entries.title: Apple gives businesses control of redesigned Place Cards and you might like them, too
entries.description: Apple unveils Business Connect to give small businesses tools to edit and manage their Place Cards.

entries.title: One in four SMBs has been hit with ransomware
entries.description: Many decide to pay the ransom despite getting no guarantees they'll get their data back.

entries.title: The weird, fleshy Stem Projector is perfect for Cronenberg movie fans
entries.description: This puck-like video-remixing beamer is the latest device from former Kanye West collaborators Kano Computing.

entries.title: The Shockwave hammer proves that Fortnite has gone too far
entries.description: The shockwave hammer got so many complaints from fans that Epic Games had to do an emergency patch to fix it, but how can it save the rest of the game?

entries.title: This horror game provides AI friends to make up for your lack of real ones
entries.description: Endnight Games are finally releasing a sequel to The Forest, and this time you can play all by yourself.

entries.title: VoLTE phone security may not be as tough as we all thought
entries.description: Researchers find a way to grab metadata and tie it to a real-life identity.

entries.title: Meet BLUETTI’s newest power solutions for the whole home and beyond
entries.description: BLUETTI’s latest power solutions can charge the whole home, integrate with solar, or even operate on the go.

entries.title: Samsung Unpacked 2023: Galaxy S23 and what else we expect
entries.description: Samsung's Galaxy S23 launch event could also be used to show off new laptops and software.

entries.title: Even some of the biggest US federal agencies are terrible at passwords
entries.description: Audit at the US Department of the Interior reveals easily cracked passwords and lack of MFA implementation.

entries.title: Twitter has hidden the chronological feed on iOS again – and I'm furious
entries.description: Twitter has rolled out a terrible change to iOS users where 'Latest' can no longer be the default option for your feed.

entries.title: One of the best RPGs of all time is coming to Game Pass
entries.description: Microsoft Game Pass rings in the new year by adding two classic RPGs and a stellar Monster Hunter game to the service.

entries.title: Intel's latest Xeon CPUs take the fight to AMD Genoa
entries.description: Intel’s latest 4th Gen Sapphire Rapids and Ponte Vecchio chips aim to bring AI power and steal AMD Genoa market share.

entries.title: ChatGPT could soon start charging you for its AI skills
entries.description: The makers of ChatGPT have started a waitlist for a paid Professional version of the chatbot, which could have big implications.

entries.title: With Vikings Valhalla season 2, Netflix turns its historical drama into an epic 11th century road-trip movie
entries.description: TechRadar speaks to Vikings Valhalla’s creator and cast about reinventing the hit Netflix history show for its highly anticipated second season.

entries.title: If you buy the Dead Space Remake you can get Dead Space 2 for free
entries.description: Fans of Dead Space will be delighted to hear that Dead Space 2 is free if you purchase the Dead Space remake.

entries.title: Apple set to move from OLED to micro-LED for future iPhone and Watch displays
entries.description: Apple has reportedly committed to developing in-house micro-LED displays for future Apple Watch and iPhone models.

entries.title: The Nothing Phone 1 is finally launching in the US... sort of
entries.description: Nothing has launched its smartphone in the US as part of a beta to test its Android 13-powered Nothing OS 1.5.

entries.title: Could AMD driver curse be back with mysterious RX 6000 failures?
entries.description: AMD RX 6800 and 6900 graphics cards are reportedly dying, prompting speculation about drivers.

entries.title: Netflix continues 2023 cancellation spree as two fan-favorite shows are axed
entries.description: Netflix has cancelled two more popular series, taking its tally to three already this year.

entries.title: The next generation of Microsoft Teams could be here sooner than expected
entries.description: Microsoft is planning to make standard Teams licenses less of a value proposition to sell users on the new Premium offering.

entries.title: The Samsung Galaxy S23 series could have loads of new and upgraded camera features
entries.description: Numerous new features could be planned for the Samsung Galaxy S23's cameras, and teaser videos have been leaked.

entries.title: The first Microsoft Patch Tuesday of 2023 includes some rather important fixes
entries.description: Almost 100 fixes were released, including final patches for Windows 7 and 8.1.
